verses.kjv: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
verses.ct: They brought the ark of God inside and placed it in the center of the tent that David had set up for it. Then they presented burnt offerings and peace offerings in God's presence.

verses.kjv: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: When David had finished presenting the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.
verses.ct: He distributed to every person in Israel, both men and women, a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.

verses.kjv: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:
verses.ct: He assigned certain Levites to serve in front of the ark of the LORD — to commemorate, give thanks, and praise the LORD God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obededom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
verses.ct: Asaph was the leader, with Zechariah second to him, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obededom. Jeiel played harps and lyres, while Asaph played the cymbals.

verses.kjv: Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.ct: Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew trumpets regularly in front of the ark of the covenant of God.

verses.kjv: Then on that day David delivered first this psalm to thank the LORD into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
verses.ct: On that day, David first entrusted this psalm of thanksgiving to the LORD to Asaph and his brothers.

verses.kjv: Give thanks unto the LORD, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
verses.ct: Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name, tell the nations what he has done.

verses.kjv: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him, talk ye of all his wondrous works.
verses.ct: Sing to him, make music to him, speak about all his amazing works.

verses.kjv: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
verses.ct: Take pride in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD be filled with joy.

verses.kjv: Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.
verses.ct: Look to the LORD and his strength; seek his presence always.

verses.kjv: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
verses.ct: Remember the incredible things he has done, his miracles and the decisions he has spoken,

verses.kjv: O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.ct: you descendants of Israel his servant, you children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

verses.kjv: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.ct: He is the LORD our God; his justice extends across the whole earth.

verses.kjv: Be ye mindful always of his covenant; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations;
verses.ct: Always keep his covenant in mind — the promise he established for 1,000 generations,

verses.kjv: Even of the covenant which he made with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;
verses.ct: the covenant he made with Abraham, and his sworn oath to Isaac.

verses.kjv: And hath confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
verses.ct: He confirmed it to Jacob as a binding decree, and to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

verses.kjv: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;
verses.ct: saying, 'I will give you the land of Canaan as your allotted inheritance.'

verses.kjv: When ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.
verses.ct: This was when you were only a small number of people, very few, and foreigners in that land.

verses.kjv: And when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people;
verses.ct: They wandered from one nation to another, from one kingdom to a different people.

verses.kjv: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
verses.ct: He did not let anyone oppress them; he even rebuked kings on their behalf,

verses.kjv: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
verses.ct: saying, 'Do not touch my anointed ones, and do not harm my prophets.'

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD, all the earth; shew forth from day to day his salvation.
verses.ct: Sing to the LORD, all the earth! Proclaim his salvation day after day.

verses.kjv: Declare his glory among the heathen; his marvellous works among all nations.
verses.ct: Announce his glory among the nations, his amazing works among all peoples.

verses.kjv: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised: he also is to be feared above all gods.
verses.ct: The LORD is great and deserves the highest praise; he is to be deeply revered above all gods.

verses.kjv: For all the gods of the people are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.
verses.ct: All the gods of the nations are worthless idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

verses.kjv: Glory and honour are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.
verses.ct: Splendor and majesty surround his presence; strength and joy fill his dwelling place.

verses.kjv: Give unto the LORD, ye kindreds of the people, give unto the LORD glory and strength.
verses.ct: Ascribe to the LORD, you families of the nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

verses.kjv: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
verses.ct: Ascribe to the LORD the glory his name deserves. Bring an offering and come into his presence. Worship the LORD in the splendor of his holiness.

verses.kjv: Fear before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
verses.ct: Tremble with reverence before him, all the earth. The world is firmly established and cannot be shaken.

verses.kjv: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The LORD reigneth.
verses.ct: Let the heavens celebrate and the earth rejoice! Let people declare among the nations, 'The LORD reigns!'

verses.kjv: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.
verses.ct: Let the sea and everything in it thunder with praise. Let the fields and everything in them celebrate.

verses.kjv: Then shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the LORD, because he cometh to judge the earth.
verses.ct: Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy in the LORD's presence, because he is coming to judge the earth.

verses.kjv: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
verses.ct: Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good; his mercy lasts forever.

verses.kjv: And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and glory in thy praise.
verses.ct: Then say, 'Rescue us, God of our salvation! Gather us and save us from the nations, so that we may give thanks to your holy name and find our glory in praising you.'

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the LORD.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD God of Israel forever and ever! All the people responded, 'Amen!' and praised the LORD.

verses.kjv: So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required:
verses.ct: David stationed Asaph and his brothers there in front of the ark of the covenant of the LORD to serve before the ark on a continual basis, handling whatever each day required.

verses.kjv: And Obededom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obededom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:
verses.ct: He also stationed Obededom and his 68 brothers. Obededom son of Jeduthun and Hosah served as gatekeepers.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,
verses.ct: Zadok the priest and his fellow priests served at the LORD's tabernacle at the worship site in Gibeon,

verses.kjv: To offer burnt offerings unto the LORD upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel;
verses.ct: presenting burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering every morning and evening, following everything written in the law of the LORD that he had commanded Israel.

verses.kjv: And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever;
verses.ct: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who had been specifically chosen by name to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy lasts forever.

verses.kjv: And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.
verses.ct: Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for the trumpets, cymbals, and other instruments used in praising God. The sons of Jeduthun served as gatekeepers.

verses.kjv: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
verses.ct: Then all the people went home to their own houses, and David returned to bless his household.
